cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':' --tags @wip -f progress`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'`
fi
hear_shout.feature:
Feature: Hearing a shout

    Shouts have a range of approximately 1000 metres

    Background:
        Given Lucy is at 0, 0

    @wip
    Scenario Outline: Only in range shouts are heard
        Given Sean is at <Seans-location>
        When Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear <what-lucy-hears>
    
        Examples: 
            | Seans-location | what-lucy-hears |
            | 0, 900         | Sean            |
            | 800, 800       | nothing         |
        
    Scenario: Multiple shouters
        Given people are located at
            | name | x    | y   |
            | Lucy | 0    | 0   |
            | Sean | 0    | 500 |
            | Oscar| 1100 | 0   |
        When Sean shouts
        And Oscar shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear Oscar
        But Lucy should hear Sean

     Scenario: Shouters do not hear their own shouts
        Given Sean is at 0, 0
        When Sean shouts
        Then Sean should hear nothing
        
     Scenario: Multiple shouts from one person
        Given Sean is at 0, 500
        When Sean shouts
        And Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear 2 shouts from Sean
